title: In-House 'Experts' Cost Taxpayers $75K
text:
In-House 'Experts' Cost Taxpayers $75K Monday, 19 October 2015, 4:29 pm 
In-House 'Experts' Cost Taxpayers $75K 
MONDAY 19 OCTOBER 2015 
Responding to the report that taxpayers are now the not-so-proud owners of a $75,000 painting thanks to Alexander Turnbull Library , despite an expert pointing out it was a fake, Taxpayers’ Union Executive Director, Jordan Williams, says: 
“This should be the last time the Library back their own ‘expertise’ over those warning it that the painting is a worthless fake. Officials should be ensuring that they are sure it is a genuine article, not selling hard working taxpayers down the river.” 
“Mr Szekely’s comments that the decision to purchase wasn’t rushed isn’t reassuring. It suggests that his staff lack the necessary skills to be procuring our national heritage using the taxpayer chequebook." 
ends New Zealand Taxpayers' Union 
New Zealand's grassroots campaign for lower taxes and less government waste 
The New Zealand Taxpayers' Union is an independent activist group, dedicated to being the voice for Kiwi taxpayers in the corridors of power. It's here to fight government waste and make sure New Zealanders get value for money from their tax dollar. New Zealanders are invited to join and donate at http://taxpayers.org.nz CONTACT NEW ZEALAND TAXPAYERS' UNION
